definition: to ignore completely/to pay no attention to sb

sentences.english: He who looks outside dreams, he who looks inside awakens.
sentences.chinese: 向外瞅的人在梦中，向内看的人苏醒灭。

sentences.english: Amos faced me quietly for a while.
sentences.chinese: 阿莫斯平静地瞅了我一会儿。

sentences.english: She stared at the brown stain that splotched the front of her dress.
sentences.chinese: 海茨帕因痛苦而目瞪口呆，瞅着她衣服前的污点。

sentences.english: For this reason it is important to make time in your study plan to review your learning.
sentences.chinese: 是以有需要在教习打算中留出时光用以回瞅学习结果。

sentences.english: Cowardice is prima facie a fault of the Chinese;
sentences.chinese: 脆弱，是中国人的令人一瞅即知的一个毛病。

sentences.english: Watching the satisfied expressions on my classmates' faces, I felt extremely down.
sentences.chinese: 瞅着我的同学们脸上满足的表情，我感到极其低落。

sentences.english: Tesla glanced at what could be seen of the hive through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 泰斯拉透过树木的缝隙瞅了母巢一眼。

sentences.english: The lecture was so dull that many students dazed off.
sentences.chinese: 这个讲痤极其枯燥，以至很多学生都瞅着了。

sentences.english: His wish to become a football star has come true.
sentences.chinese: 他念当足球亮星的愿瞅实现了。

sentences.english: He the oblique line ground start connecting to burn the second cigarette to my Chou's one eye.
sentences.chinese: 他斜线地向我瞅一眼，开始接烧第二支纸烟。

sentences.english: Men going home glance at me and smile and fill me with shame.
sentences.chinese: 回家的人们瞅着我，微笑着，令我满心羞惭。

sentences.english: He took a passing look at the political news, then turned to the sports page.
sentences.chinese: 他瞅了一眼政治新闻，接着就翻到体育版。

sentences.english: Yevlenko gave him a wise look through wreathing smoke.
sentences.chinese: 叶甫连柯通过缭绕的烟雾用狡黠的目光瞅了他一眼。

sentences.english: Hand turned over the securities, eying their gold seals .
sentences.chinese: 韩德把那些证券翻过来，瞅着上面打的金印。

sentences.english: When he woke he smiled up at the worried faces looking down at him.
sentences.chinese: 他醒来时，仰望着那些焦急地瞅着他的人们笑了笑。

definition: to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to turn one's head/to turn around
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to cast sidelong glances at sb
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
